newsitem.title: UK: Chiroscience starts verapamil isomer tests.
newsitem.headline: Chiroscience starts verapamil isomer tests.

text.p: British drug development company Chiroscience Group Plc said on Friday it started Phase 1 clinical testing of isomers of its cardiovascular drug verapamil.

The drug, being developed in partnership with Germany's Knoll AG, a unit of BASF AG, will be tested on 15 volunteers initially to determine whether the constipating effects of verapamil are caused by a particular isomer.
The study's results are expected in March next year.
The company said two further Phase 1 studies are planned for January. One will examine a potential new use for the drug.
